alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 11:09AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following county, Okaloosa. * WHEN...Until 115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1005 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms repeatedly falling over the same areas. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, especially across southeastern Okaloosa County. Additional rainfall is expected through this afternoon as more storms drift southeast across the county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Niceville, Eglin AFB, Valparaiso, Lake Lorraine, Shalimar, Postil, Eglin Village, Longwood and Seminole. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
